quarter.translation[0].definitions[0].de: one of four equal parts into which something can be divided
quarter.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: roughly one quarter of the city’s population
It’s about a page and a quarter.
three quarters of a million pounds
in the last quarter of the 19th century
quarter.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I’ll meet you in a quarter of an hour.
She arrived three quarters of an hour (=45 minutes) late.
I’ll meet you at a quarter past ten.
quarter.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a coin used in the US and Canada worth 25 cents
quarter.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a period of three months, used especially when discussing business and financial matters
quarter.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Our database is updated every quarter.
The company’s profits rose by 11% in the first quarter of the year.
quarter.translation[0].definitions[4].de: one of the four equal periods of time into which games of some sports are divided
quarter.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: The home side took the lead in the second quarter.
quarter.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: I found a small flat in the student quarter.
a historic quarter of the city
quarter.translation[0].definitions[6].de: one of the four periods into which a year at school or college is divided, continuing for 10 to 12 weeks
quarter.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: What classes are you taking this quarter?
quarter.translation[0].definitions[7].de: the period of time twice a month when you can see a quarter of the moon’s surface
quarter.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to cut or divide something into four parts
quarter.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Quarter the tomatoes and place them round the dish.
quarter.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to provide someone with a place to sleep and eat, especially soldiers
quarter.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Our troops were quartered in Boston until June.
quarter.translation[1].definitions[1].no: Quarter is usually passive in this meaning
quarter.translation[2].definitions[0].de: one of four equal parts into which something can be divided
quarter.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: They’re firing almost a quarter of the workforce.
A quarter of the project’s income comes from government grants.
quarter.translation[2].definitions[1].de: a period of three months, especially in connection with bills, payments, and income
quarter.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: We will send you a bill every quarter.
Sales in the fourth quarter rose 28% to $1.2 million
The sales director of the SMMT expects sales in the final quarter to be below those in 1999.
At the end of each financial quarter, the chief executive provides information on performance against targets.
quarter.translation[2].definitions[2].de: a coin in the US and Canada, worth 25 cents
quarter.translation[3].definitions[0].de: if something quarters or is quartered, it decreases to a quarter of what it was
quarter.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Mergers and acquisitions fees have quartered in the past year.
